DOC.brief_title: Pilot Study Assess Efficacy Botulinum Toxin B Pain Disability Subjects With Acute Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: This study ass efficacy Botulinum Toxin B ( Myobloc® ) inject lumbar paravertebral muscle reduce pain disability subject suffer acute low back pain ( duration 3 6 week ) arise identifiable muscle strain injury back trauma . The treatment modality technique use base upon three successful prior open-labeled pilot study do research group investigate effect Botulinum Toxin A ( BOTOX® ) relief chronic low back pain . This study , however , employ prospective , double-blind , randomize , placebo control trial control placebo mechanical trigger-point injection effect . Subjects also assess 3 month define duration efficacy Myobloc® . Sixty subject randomly assign one two group receive either Myobloc® placebo injection lumbar paravertebral muscle . The subject assess use validated scale pain disability prior injection weekly monthly thereafter three month . All subject continue receive medication physiotherapy per standard care treatment record control data analysis .
